intro: Protium heptaphyllum var. surinamense, commonly known as Surinam chestnut, is a member of the Burseraceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that can reach heights of up to 20 meters. The plant is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and simple, alternate leaves that are elliptic to ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants. The fruit is a globose, woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in tropical forest ecosystems.
